title: Poverty stricken BJP govt has little funds left to support our higher education institutions, basically the hopes and dreams of countless millions of middle class. IITs, DU, UGC etc have suffered huge cuts in funding last few years. Also the govt is subsidizing companies, helping in record profits
selftext:
This troubling trend is barely talked about. In my company, I've seen it benefiting by 1-2 billions dollars per year over last 4 years. In 2019, corporate tax was cut to 25% , a historic low. That quarter itself, with arrears, many companies made banks! From that time to today, just my company has made 1-2 billions dollars extra per year, enough to fully fund all premium institutions like IITs, DU, BHU, JNU etc. 
But Mrs Nirmala sitaraman can't find funds in their empty coffers for frivolous things like higher education and dreams of most of middle class. 
Now we will also be gradually sold Indian dream. Everyone will hope that he'll one day become a billionaire or atleast a millionaire without understanding the basics of economics. Modi's solution for this is to change names of all colleges to IIM IIT AIIMS and further along the names will be changed to Harvard Stanford etc..
comments: Ye Modi BJP barbaad kar dega Desh ko. I've woken up from their maaya jaal.. Much lesser of a supporter now..
I am not surprised. Illiterates can’t value education, they understand only religious riots, corruption and whataboutism.
C b to banana hai andhbhakto ko media k through

Educating and developing the masses will lead to reduction in blind supporters. So what is the motivation for election minded parties to pay for that. Keep masses poor and uneducated and struggling. Then release whatsapp propaganda on them, giving them an outlet to vent. Foot soldiers for riots ready.

I won't blame the BJP only. It's important to identify the fault lines in the opposing sides as well if we really want peace and harmony. Dynastic politics, religious appeasement politics, Islamic fundamentalism, obsession with Pakistan etc are also equally valid reasons.

I'm just gonna leave this rant by the late, great, George Carlin here:

"But there’s a reason education sucks, and it’s the same reason that it will never, ever, ever be fixed. It’s never gonna get any better. Because the owners of this country don't want that. I'm talking about the real owners now, the real owners, the big wealthy business interests that control things and make all the important decisions. Forget the politicians. The politicians are put there to give you the idea that you have freedom of choice. You don't. You have no choice. You have owners. They own you. They own everything. They own all the important land. They own and control the corporations. They’ve long since bought and paid for the senate, the congress, the state houses, the city halls, they got the judges in their back pockets and they own all the big media companies so they control just about all of the news and information you get to hear. They got you by the balls.... They want more for themselves and less for everybody else, but I'll tell you what they don’t want: They don’t want a population of citizens capable of critical thinking. They don’t want well informed, well educated people capable of critical thinking. They’re not interested in that. That doesn’t help them. Thats against their interests. They don’t want people who are smart enough to sit around a kitchen table to figure out how badly they’re getting fucked by a system that threw them overboard 30 fucking years ago. You know what they want? They want obedient workers. People who are just smart enough to run the machines and do the paperwork, and just dumb enough to passively accept all these increasingly shittier jobs with the lower pay, the longer hours, the reduced benefits, the end of overtime and the vanishing pension that disappears the minute you go to collect it..."

Just good ole side effects of New Eduction Policy model as proposed by Birla-Ambani entitled “A Policy Framework for Reforms in Education” in 2020. Vajpayee and his committee were smart enough to see through them, alas.

https://www.newindianexpress.com/business/2019/nov/29/after-19-years-government-favours-birla-ambani-report-on-education-reforms-2068881.html
Not just bjp. Almost every party has taken money off education and put into profitable businesses. The need to keep the masses in control is a common need
Then there seems to be a bigger conspiracy going on. For few decades, media has heavily promoted as gospel truth that there's huge disconnect between industry and actual education
Right. Unless there's a common agreement and awareness amongst the masses regarding what is right and wrong, things would be difficult.
Considering all this you have gotta hand it over to kejri since he has focused on education and has brought a lot of changes in primary education at least.
but even the so called educated IITs and doctors and such are doing bhakti. So not much is gonna change.

>For few decades, media has heavily promoted as gospel truth that there's huge disconnect between industry and actual education

You got proof suggesting otherwise? Cuz that side has a "85% of graduates are unemployable" on their side.

Modi Sarkar prefers the youth (future voters) grow up without rational thinking skills. Education is not only not a priority for them, it’s harmful to the BJP agenda.

This isn’t remotely news and whoever gets shocked by the fact that education is being systematically corrupted and defunded, has been living under a rock.

By the way, govt is having trouble finding money to pay army pension too. Yes crores are being spent everyday on advertisements (not to mention the new PM’s residence and parliament).

I don't understand how people don't understand how fascist parties work - they like to project power and glory. You will get roads, buildings, stations, statues but nothing that can't be seen like education, health etc.
